Violence in schools: From bowling to stabbing
A 16-year-old man injured his classmate's back in the courtyard of the 1st Amaliada High School - Reflection on the absence of surveillance.
01 Nov 2019, 11:01 by TOBMA Team
From bowling and bullying, to attacks and stabbings. Something is happening in our country's schools. And of course, as experts say in the "NEWS", focusing on the specific dimension of each incident of violence and separating it from an overall picture of problem management is a policy that seems dangerous.
For yesterday's student stabbing in a school in Amaliada, there were many who commented yesterday that the glass was about to overflow.
